result.heading: A FINELY WRAPPED PACKET OF VIOLIN STRINGS

direction.raw_text: . TOWNHOUSE/STUDY - DAY 1 -EARLY APRIL, 1841- We are close on a PAIR OF BLACK HANDS as they open A FINELY WRAPPED PACKET OF VIOLIN STRINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the hands stringing a VIOLIN. It's not a high end piece, but it is quite nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a wide shot of the study. Sitting in a chair with violin in hand is SOLOMON NORTHUP; a man in his late twenties. Everything about Solomon, his mien and manner, is distinguished. But he, too, seems a hardy individual. Someone who has known manual labor in his time. Solomon begins to lightly play his violin, as if testing the strings, their tuning. Satisfied, Solomon begins to play vigorously. As he does, we make a HARD CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We come in on a lively affair. A dinner party is being thrown within the confines of a fairly stately house. In attendance are EIGHT COUPLES. All are WHITE and all are
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in their early twenties. The men and women are dressed in very fine attire. We should get the sense that for the most part they are people of means. The furniture has been set aside in the living room. At the moment the couples are engaged in the dancing of a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The music they are dancing to is being played by Solomon, having cut directly from the tune he was previously playing. He plays with a light determination, and in no way seems possessed with empty servitude. Solomon concludes the reel, and the dancers break into enthusiastic applause, which is followed by personal thanks and congratulations from all. It should be clear that despite their respective races there is much admiration and appreciation for Solomon's abilities.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a Saturday morning. Clad in her finest attire is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ; Solomon's wife, a few years younger than he. We see also the Northup children: MARGARET who is eight, and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who is five. They are handsome, and well groomed kids. Anne straightens up the children. She finishes, (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: she rises up and stands behind them, almost as if preparing to pose for a portrait. They all wait a moment, then Solomon enters the foyer. He stands and looks admiringly at his family. ADMIRINGLY stressed. It isn't that he doesn't have love for them, he does as well. But in the moment, he truly admires his greatest accomplishment: a family that is healthy and well and provided for. He goes to his children, and hands each a coin, then goes to Anne. Gives her a kiss on the cheek. The children giggle at the sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon and his family are out walking along the streets and groves of Saratoga. The streets are well populated this morning with many people out strolling. Most are WHITE, but there are
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as well. They are FREED BLACKS who mingle fairly easily - though not always completely - with the whites. We see, too, a few BLACK SLAVES who travel with their
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . These pairings are largely from the south and - despite the fact the blacks are slaves - they are not physically downtrodden, not field hands. They are well dressed and "leading apparently an easy life" - comparatively speaking - as they trail their masters. As they walk, Solomon and his family arrive to an intersection well-worn and muddied from horse and cart traffic. Solomon and his children easily jump across the muck. Anne stands at the lip of the puddle, calls for Solomon to help her across.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon... Solomon, turning back to his wife with a broad smile waving her forward:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, Anne. Jump. The children, now smiling as well, egg their mother on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jump. You can make it. I've done it. You can make it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will not ruin my dress. Catch me! Solomon moves close, holds out his arms. Yet, there's still just a bit of mischievousness in his eyes. Anne gives her husband a lightly stern look to which Solomon replies. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will catch you, Anne. (BEAT) I will. Again, lightly stern:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will. And with that Anne takes the leap. Solomon catches her, swings her around grandly and sets her down lightly to the delighted applause of the children. That done, Solomon takes Anne's hand and leads her on. As Solomon and his family make their way, among the slaves on the street, we see one in particular; JASPER. As he trails his MASTER he can't help but note Solomon and his family as they enter A STORE. His intrigue of this most handsome and harmonious group should be obvious. With his Master occupied, Jasper moves slyly toward the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Frozen on the spot, Jasper looks on admiringly. Suddenly a voice barks out-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Jasper! Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are inside the store of MR. CEPHAS PARKER; a white man and a supplier of general goods. Solomon greets him
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Parker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Northup. Mrs. Northup. With money in hand the Northup children move quickly about the store looking for items to purchase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anne looks over some silks and fabrics. Parker suggests
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A new cravat, Solomon? Pure silk by way of the French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are in need of a fresh carry all for the Mrs's travels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A year's passed? Off to Sandy Hill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am. Using a long pole, Mr. Parker fetches down a CARRY ALL from an upper shelf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something to suit your style, but sturdy enough for the forty miles round trip. Handing the Bag to Anne, she is immediately taken by it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At what price?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We will take it. Children, come see what your father has just purchased for me. As the children run over - chattering excitedly about the new gift - they RUN PAST JASPER who has quietly entered the store. At the checkout counter sits a portrait of WILLIAM HENRY HARRISON, the edges draped in black crepe. Before the book sits a LEDGER. Mr. Parker asks of Solomon:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you would sign our condolence book. My hope is to find a way to forward it to the Widow Harrison. Sad days for the nation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, certainly. Poor Mrs. Harris and her children. I hope brighter times ahead. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jasper looks scared, timid. It's as though he'd like to engage, but is unsure of as to how. Noting Jasper, Parker
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A moment, sir, and you will be assisted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we could discuss the price... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forgive me, Mrs. Northup. A customer waits. Welcome, sir. To Jasper, with good nature:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shop well, but mind your wallet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ignore the gentleman's nonsense. Now, may I interest you in a new cravat? Pure silk by way of the-- Before Parker can finish, the door opens. It's Jasper's Master, FITZGERALD. He's stern, clearly displeased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jasper! (TO PARKER) My regrets for the intrusion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No intrusion. Fitzgerald looks to Solomon. It is a cold glare as though he wasn't speaking to, and has no interest in a response from a black man. Looking back to Parker:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good day, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NORTHUP HOUSE/DINING ROOM - EVENING Anne, busy in the kitchen, puts the final touches to the meal, which is just about to begin. Solomon, in the meanwhile, sits at the head of the table reading from a
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He reads to his children solemn news of the funeral arrangements for the recently deceased President Harrison.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Thus has passed away from earth our late President." Solomon starts from the top of the article.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "During the morning, from sunrise, the heavy bells had been pealing forth their slow and solemn toll while the minute guns announced that soon the grave would receive its trust. Our city as well as our entire nation has been called to weep over the fall of a great and good man. One who was by the wishes of a large majority of our (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: people raised to fill the highest place of trust within their gift. William Henry Harrison." A long moment of quiet, the family continuing to eat. Then, from Margaret:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you read it again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not just now, darling. Anne enters the dining room and places a large chicken at the center of the table. As she takes a seat, all heads are bowed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For food that stays our hunger, For rest that brings us ease, For homes where memories linger, We give our thanks for these.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Margaret, that was wonderful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Papa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alonzo, do you have something to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I helped Momma make this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, and you were such a good help. Especially making the gravy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Papa, I would very much like to learn how to play the violin. Could you teach me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but I asked Papa first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both of you, calm down. We will have our first lesson after this wonderful dinner. And on that note, let's start eating. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The family all tuck in to their meal. The scene is one of warmth and happiness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NORTHUP HOUSE - NIGHT 7 Solomon and Anne have fun and difficulty putting the unruly children to bed. They are tucked in, and each given a kiss good night. As Margaret lays down to sleep, Anne blows out the candle darkening the room. Silhouetted in the doorway, Solomon takes Anne in his arms, holds her tightly as they both luxuriate in the simple, beautiful gift that is their children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NORTHUP HOUSE - NIGHT Now alone together, we see Anne and Solomon wrapped in each other's arms. Beyond being physically close, emotionally close, they are just so very comfortable with one another. They are the very representation of a couple who are made for each other. They look at each other for a prolonged time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three weeks. Two days. ANNE It is the custom. I wonder what you'll do without me? SOLOMON I won't stay idle. SOLOMON's eyes lower. ANNE Darling, it's good money. SOLOMON If only I didn't have to share your cooking with other people. ANNE holds his gaze. ANNE You don't. They kiss. 8 OMIT 8 7.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NORTHUP HOUSE - MORNING 9 We are just outside the Northup house. A CARRIAGE waits with a DRIVER. Anne and the children are dressed for travel - Anne sporting HER NEW CARRY ALL. The Driver loads bags into the carriage. For her parting gift, Anne gives her husband a kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Travel safely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay safely. Anne and the children loaded up, the Driver chides the horse and the carriage heads off. Solomon waves a hearty good bye to his wife and children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARK - DAY Solomon is now out for a stroll. He passes two men - two in particular - who stand outside conversing with MR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: himself: MERRILL BROWN and ABRAM HAMILTON. Brown is about 40, with a countenance indicating shrewdness and intelligence. Hamilton is closer to 25, a man of fair complexion and light eyes. Both are finely, if perhaps a bit garishly, dressed. Hamilton, as Solomon describes him, slightly effeminate. Moon, spotting Solomon:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOON Call the Devil's name... There he is now. Mr. Northup...! I have two gentlemen who should make your acquaintance. Messrs. Brown and Hamilton.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MOON Mr. Northup, these two gentlemen were inquiring about distinguished individuals, and I was just this very moment telling them that Solomon Northup is an expert player on the violin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was indeed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Moon is being overly gracious. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taking into consideration his graciousness and your modesty, may we trouble you for a moment of your time to converse, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PARK/PAVILION - LATER We make a jump to a green space. Solomon, Brown and Hamilton are sitting at a bench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A circus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is our usual employee. The company currently in the city of Washington.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Circus too constricting a word to describe the talented and merry band with which we travel. It is a spectacle unlike most have ever witnessed. Creatures from the darkest Africa as yet unseen by civilized man. Acrobats from the Orient able to contort themselves in the most confounding manners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I myself in aide of Mr. Brown; an internationally renowned practitioner in the art of prestidigitation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are on our way thither to rejoin the company having left for a short time to make a small profit from our own exhibitions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The reason for our inquiry with Mr. Moon...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. We had just a devil of a time in procuring music for our (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: entertainments. Men of true talent seemingly in short supply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you sir...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we could persuade you to accompany us as far as New York... We would give you one dollar for each day's service and three dollars for every night played at our performances. In addition we would provide sufficient pay for the expenses of your return from New York here to Saratoga.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You understand this is all very sudden.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consider it an opportunity to see
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's intriguing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there is any way in which you would give consideration to the offer... Solomon gives the whole deal one last consideration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The payment offered is enticement enough, as is my desire to visit the metropolis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are delighted, sir. So delighted. Though we would add that our travel plans--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We would like to depart with haste. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As luck would have it, my wife and children are traveling. I will write her of our plans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excellent! I would beg you collect yourself, then we may proceed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NORTHUP HOUSE/BEDROOM - LATER Back in his house, we see Solomon packing: putting some clothes in a travel case, and collecting his violin as well.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: WITH LITTLE THOUGHT HE TEARS THE PAPER AND SETS IT ASIDE
WE SHOULD GET THE SENSE THAT THE ABSOLUTE VALUE OF BEING ABLE TO COMMUNICATE BY LETTER IS LOST ON SOLOMON
THIS FACT WILL HAVE GREAT WEIGHT IN THE NEAR FUTURE

direction.raw_text: . NORTHUP HOUSE/STUDY - LATER 13 Solomon sits down to write a letter; pen poised over paper with already a few lines written. But Solomon thinks better of it. WITH LITTLE THOUGHT HE TEARS THE PAPER AND SETS IT ASIDE. WE SHOULD GET THE SENSE THAT THE ABSOLUTE VALUE OF BEING ABLE TO COMMUNICATE BY LETTER IS LOST ON SOLOMON. THIS FACT WILL HAVE GREAT WEIGHT IN THE NEAR FUTURE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . SOLOMON'S HOUSE/INT. COVERED CARRIAGE - LATER Solomon enters the buggy, carpet bag in hand. Brown and Hamilton are waiting. They ride in a covered carriage led by a pair of "noble" horses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No letter to post?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No need. My return will coincide with my family's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're off then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PUB - EVENING -MID TO LATE APRIL, 1841- We find ourselves in a roadside pub. It serves the purpose of drinking and diversion, and little more. As Solomon plays his violin, Brown and Hamilton perform a decent, paired magic routine before a SPARSE AUDIENCE NOT OF "SELECT CHARACTER."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PUB - LATER 16 After the show, the pub now fairly empty, Solomon, Hamilton and Brown sit down to eat. Hamilton and Brown drink, but again Solomon abstains. Though Solomon remains cool, Hamilton and Brown put up a great show of being disappointed as Hamilton counts out what little money was collected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not an additional tip from a one of them. They expect to be entertained for nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And not satisfied a bit despite giving them more than what they paid for.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's the national mood. There's too much grief to make room for frivolity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My sincerest apologies, Solomon. You were promised opportunity, and you were given none.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The opportunity is with the circus. A two man show poorly promoted, what were we to expect? But the circus bills itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: True.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have told you of the circus with which we are connected. Creatures from the darkest of Africa. Acrobats from the Orient who--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have described it, yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. We need to return immediately to Washington. Solomon...I believe us familiar enough now, but forgive me if I am bold...would you consider making the trip with us? Solomon gives a bit of a laugh at the idea. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Entertaining at pubs and inns has it's place, but a man of your skills deserves better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hear, hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And more importantly you would build your own name and following. The circus tends to attract those with the highest of reputations. An introduction here and there could amount to a lifetime of reward. Now would be the time. With your family away, an opportunity presents itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Said as fellow artists as well as businessmen. Well worth the effort at least.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You present a flattering representation. As my family will be traveling back shortly, perhaps I might commit only to one trial engagement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, very good, sir. Very good. I cannot recall being so excited.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a practical concern. If you are to continue on with us you should obtain your free papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not necessary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here in New York, no. But we will be entering slave states and as a matter of precaution... It's to all our benefit we should not have to come to account for your well being.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six shillings worth of effort could well save much trouble later. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll go to the Customs House in the morning, then travel on. Good business all around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WASHINGTON - DAY 18 The city is a swarm of people. At the moment the populace is displaying both sorrow and anticipation. Sorrow for the loss of the President. Many are dressed in black, and black crepe hangs nearly everywhere. Black armbands are frequently seen, and the occasional American Flag hung at half mast. As well, there are portraits of Harrison at varying locations. Having arrived in Washington, Solomon, Hamilton and Brown
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GADSBY HOTEL/DINNING ROOM - EVENING A decent though crowded, boisterous and smoke-filled joint. Very lively. Solomon, Hamilton and Brown are among several parties drinking in the hotel's bar. As with seemingly everywhere in the city black crepes accessorize the background. Brown counts out $43.00 IN COIN on the tabletop. Solomon is astonished by the amount.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forty-three dollars. All to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That...it's far more than my wages amount to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consider the remainder an advance from the circus. I cannot tell you...I honestly wish you had seen the expression of our director when I described your abilities. He was fairly overcome with excitement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should have invited him to sup with us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did. I did, but so many preparations before the company is to depart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tomorrow we shall prepare for our Washington debut. But tonight, our thoughts are with the great man (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: for whom this city prepared solemn memorial. He has passed from the praise of men to receive the plaudit of his heavenly father. A fine man has passed. Let us remember him with a drink. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Both Hamilton and Brown hold up their tankards to drink. Solomon, a bit reluctantly, does the same.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another. Our departed President deserves all the salutation we can imbibe. Hamilton and Brown drink again, and Solomon does as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ALLEY - LATER 22 WE MAKE A HARD CUT to Solomon outside of the Pub, in an alley, with Brown and Hamilton in silhouette, back-lit by the street lights. He is violently ill, hunched over and retching horribly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all right Solomon. No shame in it. No shame at all.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: LATER 22 WE MAKE A HARD CUT

direction.raw_text: . GADSBY HOTEL - STAIRCASE A23 Hamilton and Brown help Solomon to lumber up the spiral staircase, passing the occasional bemused guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GADSBY HOTEL/SOLOMON'S ROOM - NIGHT 23 Hamilton is placing a spittoon near Solomon's bed, where a prone and reeling Solomon lays. Hamilton sits on the bed. As he strokes Solomon's sweaty face, Hamilton speaks sweetly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid that Brown and I haven't brought you much luck. But rough waters bring smooth sailing. Eventually they do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ....So...so sorry...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shhh. We won't hear it. We won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmm. A good night's sleep. And tomorrow...tomorrow you will feel as well and refreshed as though the earth were new again. Hamilton lingers a bit too long and a bit too close to Solomon for Brown's taste. With more than a bit of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hamilton! Nothing more we can do for him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Such is the pity. Displaying an odd sort of disappointment, Hamilton slinks away from the bed. He crosses to, and BLOWS OUT A CANDLE. The room goes dark with a blackness more than night. Brown and Hamilton exit. Solomon lays in the dark and moans. His sounds becoming MORE AND MORE DISTRESSED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON - DAWN (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon stirs, then slowly awakes to his new circumstances. He finds himself in a nearly lightless room about twelve feet square with walls of solid masonry. There is a thick and well-locked door, a small window covered with iron bars and a shutter. The only furniture is a wood stool and an old fashioned, dirty box stove. As Solomon rises he sees that his HANDS are
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - the chain running to a bolt in the ground - and his LEGS IN IRONS. At first Solomon is incredulous. But that emotion is replaced first by fury and then panic. He begins to pull on the chains, fight against them. He does so with increasing desperation. Solomon flails about, the sounds of the steel chains whipping and beating against the masonry. He grunts and screams without regard as the cuffs and irons bite into his flesh, but he cannot pull himself free. After several minutes of intense effort, Solomon tires, slows, then finally he collapses. And in this collapsed state he remains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON - MORNING Solomon again awakens. He hears sounds beyond the door...footsteps. Eventually the door opens. Enter
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - who runs the slave pen - and EBENEZER RADBURN who works as a turnkey and overseer. As the door opens, this is the first light to seep into the otherwise near-black room. The shine is painful to Solomon's eyes. With no salutation whatsoever, Burch
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, my boy, how yah feel now? Solomon rises up as best he can. With all the resolve he can put together he states what he considers to be fact:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Solomon Northup. I am a free man; a resident of Saratoga, New York. The residence also of my wife and children who are equally free. I have papers. You have no right whatsoever to detain me--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah not any--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I promise you - I promise - upon my liberation I will have satisfaction for this wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Resolve this. Produce your papers. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With confidence Solomon goes to the pocket of his trousers. He searches one, then the other, but they are empty. He feels quickly about himself, but clearly his papers have been lifted. Solomon's confidence shifts, but to resolve rather than fear. Papers or none, he will not be easily cowed. Still, Burch asserts:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah no free man. And yah ain't from Saratoga. Yah from Georgia. A moment. Not a word spoken among the trio, but Solomon and Burch do some serious eye fucking, neither man yielding. Burch says again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah ain't a free man. Yah nuthin' but a Georgia runaway. Burch waits for Solomon to acquiesce. Solomon does not in any way. Both men exchange a long and daring stare. The two are clearly at an intellectual stand off. Burch, leans to Radburn, SAYS SOMETHING WHICH WE CANNOT DISTINGUISH. Radburn walks off-camera and returns with a pair of "instruments:" a PADDLE - the flattened portion, which is about the size in circumference of two open hands, and bored with a small auger in numerous places. He also carries a WHIP. A cat-o-nine tails; a large rope of many strands. The strands unraveled and a knot tied at the extremity of each. Burch says again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah a runaway nigger from Georgia. Solomon stands with a quiet stoicism. He will say nothing of the kind. As that is the case, Solomon is seized by both men. He is pulled over the bench, face downward, shirt still on his back. Radburn then STEPS ON HIS CHAINS, holding Solomon down in a bent position. With no preamble, Burch begins to beat Solomon about the back with the paddle. Burch strikes him wordlessly - no taunting, no sneering. Solomon screaming against each blow. His back immediately SWELLING WITH WELTS AND BRUISES. This beating continues on and on and on until quite literally Burch WEARS HIMSELF OUT with the effort. Dripping in sweat and panting: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SAYS SOMETHING WHICH WE CANNOT DISTINGUISH

direction.raw_text: Yah still insist yah a free man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...I...I insist... Burch regrets hearing this. Not from sympathy, but rather because he's nearly too tired to go back to beating Solomon. Yet, as if returning to work, Burch returns to pummeling Solomon. Burch punctuates the blows
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah a slave. Yah a Georgia slave! Burch continues to strike, and strike... This time until the paddle SNAPS IN HALF. Burch then GRABS THE WHIP. Hardly missing a stroke, he whips Solomon relentlessly, the flails cutting into Solomon's back. Again, Burch's arm tires before Solomon "breaks."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are yah slave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...No... Burch goes back to whipping and whipping, and whipping...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Finally Burch can whip no more. He pours sweat and sucks air, leaving himself just enough energy to take up his instruments and EXIT. Radburn lingers for a moment. He takes the irons off Solomon's legs. Opens the window some. As he makes these gestures, in a patronizing and confidential manner, one wrought with poor sincerity::
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I seen a good many of the black kind just where yah're. Sick. Make me sick. Often times the situation was resolved, and I think; what was all the beatin' and abuse for? Things end as they should, and the violence was for naught. So why cause trouble when they ain't no cause for it? Be of a cooperative nature, and things don't need be particularly unpleasant. (BEAT) Or, yah can carry on like yah been, and I fear yah won't live to see Sunday next. With that thought, Radburn exits. Solomon rests. But to rest seems like giving in to defeat. He begins pulling (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SOLOMON'S BACK IS NOW TORN OPEN WITH LACERATIONS AND OOZING WITH BLOOD

direction.raw_text: on his chains. But for all his struggling, the chain loosens none. Solomon calls out:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help me! Someone help me! If anyone at all hears him, they do not respond. Solomon continues his plaintive cry for assistance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON - CONTINUOUS Beginning with a TIGHT SHOT on the shuttered, barred window of Burch's dungeon - Solomon's cries barely eking beyond the space - THE CAMERA PULLS BACK from the building, onto the city until clearly visible is the Nation's capital. It's icon's of freedom - the WHITE HOUSE, the CAPITOL BUILDING - fairly mocking Solomon's captivity. Simultaneously, barren at the early hour and cluttered with litter and the remains of previous day's procession, the city is a bleak and forboding sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON - DAY IT IS DAY NOW. The door to the yard is thrown open. The harsh white light floods all over Solomon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 29 MOVED TO SC. A32 29 21.

result.heading: A COUPLE OF BUCKETS OF COLD WATER

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON/YARD - DAY 30 It is a yard just beyond Burch's. The yard is hemmed in by a brick wall. In the yard are two men, and a boy. The oldest is CLEMENS RAY a man of about 25 years of age. He is well educated. JOHN WILLIAMS is about 20 years old. He is born and bred a slave, is lacking in education, and overwhelmed with fear of the situation. Finally there is a child about 10 years of age who answers to the name of Randall. Solomon, Clemens Ray, John and Randall ALL STAND NAKED. Though they try to cover their privates a bit, they are all aware of the uselessness of modesty. Radburn is present. He has before him A COUPLE OF BUCKETS OF COLD WATER. He throws water on the naked men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on. Warsh up. The men, soaking in humility as well as water, begin to scrub with A SINGLE BAR OF HARSH SOAP passed among them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boy, too. Get him clean. Solomon takes some soap and rubs it over Randall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Scrub now. Git 'em clean. Solomon scrubs harder. Randall - clearly cold and uncomfortable - appeals to Solomon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know when my Mama will come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hush him up! Seeing Solomon has no answer for him, Randall begins to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama ..! Mama! Is she going to come? Doing all he can to spare the child from a certain
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quiet, please. Randall is becoming nearly inconsolable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Saying anything to keep the boy quiet:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your mother will come, I swear she will, but you must be silent. Please. Be silent! On the seeming strength of Solomon's promise, Randall goes silent. Solomon looks to Radburn, who just throws water on the soapy men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON - EVENING A32 Radburn brings food in to Solomon; a shriveled piece of meat and some water. Just barely enough to sustain Solomon. Radburn also has a SHIRT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That old thing of yours is just rags and tatters. Need something proper to wear. Solomon doesn't move for the clothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go'won. Put it on. With slow defiance, Solomon does as instructed. He removes what remains of his old shirt - the one he was wearing when first kidnapped - and puts on the one Radburn brought him. The shirt's ill-fitting and dirty. Despite that, Radburn says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. Tha's fine. Tha's fine. Got no gratitude?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Thank you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yah keep bein' proper, yah'll see how things work out. Radburn starts to take the old shirt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! It was from my wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rags and tatters. Rags and tatters. Taking the shirt, the "rags and tatters" as he calls them, Radburn exits, locking the door behind him. Solomon sits with the plate of food before him. He pushes the plate away rather than eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON/YARD - DAY Sitting together out in the yard are Clemens Ray, John and Solomon. Over time they have drawn trustworthy enough to speak with one another. At the moment Solomon is still trying to apply reason to the situation. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Randall wanders about in the background. As usual, he calls out for his "Mama." By now, however, his calls should feel like little more than background noise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This can't stand. It is a crime. I believe now someone lay in wait for me. My drink was altered... We are free men. They have...they have no right to hold us. Solomon waits for a response from the others. They give none.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need a sympathetic ear. If we have an opportunity to explain our
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who in your estimation is that sympathetic ear?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men I journeyed with. I'm certain they're making inquires at this very moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would be just as certain they are counting the money paid for delivering you to this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They were not kidnappers. They were artists. Fellow performers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that? You know for certain who they were? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fact is, Solomon can't say for certain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How I reckon the situation: whatever past we had...well, that's done now. The reality to come is us being transported southward. New Orleans if I were to venture. After we arrive, we'll be put to market. Beyond that... Well, once in a slave state I suppose there's only one outcome.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't say that to give you empty agitation, John...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For y'all. For y'all they ain't nothin' but that! But John was'n kidnapped. John bein' hold as debt, tha's all. Massa pay his debt, and John be redeemed--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boy, our masters will not come for us. John is nearly beside himself with panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now John's...John's sorry for y'all, but tha's how it be. Where y'all goin', yah goin' witout John. Massa take care of me. Massa take care.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mama! All three men turn and look. At the moment Randall doesn't call out emptily. At the door to the yard is Burch along with two women. One in her late twenties;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . She is "arrayed in silk, with rings upon her fingers, and golden ornaments suspended from her ears." Though a slave, Eliza was a mistress and has - to this point - lived well. This is reflected in her airs and her speech. The other is a little girl, light in skin color, of about seven or eight. This is EMILY, Randall's half sister. As she enters the yard Eliza squeals with high delight, then breaks into tears of both sorrow and joy. Clearly this is mother and child being reunited. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Burch locks the yard door, Eliza clutches Randall. She is overcome with emotion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My darling. My sweet, sweet baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON - EVENING Later in the evening. Solomon now shares his space with Eliza and her children. As the children rest, Eliza drops into a lament as if pleading her case to Solomon who lends a sympathetic ear. Both slyly, and with a bit of aggrandizement:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I say I had my master's favor, you understand. Above even his own wife, I had it. Do you know that he built a house for me? Built it on the sole condition that I reside there with him. The added promise in time I would be emancipated. And for nine years he blessed me with every comfort and luxury in life. Displaying the finery she still wears:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silks and jewels and even servants to wait upon us. Such was our life, and the life of this beautiful girl I bore for him. But Master Berry's daughter...she always looked at me with an unkind nature. She hated Emily no matter she and Emily were flesh of flesh. As Master Berry's health failed, she gained power in the household. Eventually, I was brought to the city on the false pretense of our free papers being executed. If I had known what waited; to be sent south? I swear I would not have come here alive. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliza turns to her children:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My poor, poor babies.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: A KEY TURNS IN THE LOCK AND THE DOOR OPENS

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON - NIGHT 34 It's the deep of night, all are sleeping. A KEY TURNS IN THE LOCK AND THE DOOR OPENS. Burch enters with Radburn beside him. Both carry LANTERNS with them. Hardly giving Solomon and Eliza a moment to rouse themselves,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. Get yer blankets. Get up. Sensing that things will not end well:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, please don't...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to hear yer talk. Get in the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ain't no need for all that. Putting hand to Randall's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jus takin' a li'l trip, tha's all. Don't want to frighten the chil'ren none over a li'l boat ride, do yah? Eliza gives a shake of her head to the negative.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright then. Git yerselves up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON/YARD - NIGHT We now have Solomon, Clemens, John, Eliza and the children. They are being cuffed together. As John is cuffed, he pulls back. Scared. He beings in
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John's massa gunna pay his debt. John's massa gunna come for him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not wanting to hear any of this talk, Burch strikes John several times in the head with a sap-like instrument. Weakened, but again:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John's massa gunna-- Burch again strikes John until he's quiet. Curiously, Emily and Randall don't even flinch. Why would they? They are quite used to seeing this kind of violence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not a word out of none a yah. Not a word. Burch and Radburn begin driving the shackled slaves from the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BURCH'S DUNGEON/INT. WAGON/FLAT BED - LATER The slaves are lead to a flat bed of the horse and carriage. They are made to lay down side-by-side. We stay with them as some sort of cloth is flung over them, obscuring and blacking out their view. At that moment, the screen is BLACKENED and we hear the sound of the cart moving in haste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WASHINGTON, D.C. DOCK - NIGHT Led by Burch, the group of slaves arrive to a dock. They are taken quickly up a gangplank and onto the steamboat
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as the CAPTAIN, CREW and a MULATTO WOMAN WATCH, but do not interfere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ORLEANS/HOLD - CONTINUOUS The slaves are hustled down one at a time into a dark, dank hold among barrels and boxes of freight...and RATS. Burch comes around and "checks" the chains; makes sure they are all secure and locked. Satisfied, he heads up out of the hold. Radburn follows. Alone in the dark in the hold, John cries, as does Eliza. Solomon stares down Burch for as long as he can, as if wishing bad things. As if wanting to exact some measure of revenge. But the greater insult is that Burch and Radburn, engaged in conversation, take no notice of Solomon whatsoever. He is that insignificant to them. That fact, that reality, makes Solomon boil with a rage he cannot express in words.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . STEAMBOAT - NIGHT 38A We are now in the engine room of the steamboat, pistons pumping, black oily cogs turning, the power and the rhythm are both aggressive and hypnotic. A shovel comes into view, feeding the furnace. 38B EXT. SEA - DUSK/DAWN 38B The steamboat is en route between Washington and Norfolk. We tilt up from the violent water foam to the powering paddles of the boat. 39 MOVED TO 43A 39 29.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ORLEANS/HOLD - LATER - NIGHT 43 Down in the hold the slaves eat, pray. The MULATTO WOMAN moves among them, catching ELIZA's eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheer up and don't be so cast down. Clemens Ray and Solomon watch as the Mulatto Woman returns to top deck, the trapdoor locked firmly behind her. Clemens Ray turns to Solomon with a deadpan stern expression. CLEMENS RAY If you want to survive, do and say as little as possible. Tell no one who you really are and tell no one that you can read and write. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clemens Ray turns away from Solomon, eyes lost into the distance. CLEMENS RAY (CONT'D) (SLOWLY) Unless you want to be a dead nigger. Solomon's face is one of a confused despair. 43A EXT. NORFOLK/PORT - DAY 43A We see a flat overhead view of the port of Norfolk. Sardines are laid out to dry in rows, glittering in the day's sun as if like silver pennies. A chain of slaves enter the frame and are led one by one on to the docked vessel. MORE SLAVES - about 15 in all, of various genders and ages - are brought on board. Chief among them is ROBERT who fights viciously with his captors. "With all haste" is shoved down into the hold. Having taken their cargo as far as they care or need to, Burch and Radburn depart. They do so without a word spoken to Solomon or the others. With this new and sizable batch of slaves on board, the crew again CASTS OFF, and the Orleans makes its way again. 44 INT. ORLEANS/GALLEY 44 Solomon is back cleaning in the galley. As he cleans, he again watches Robert prep food. Robert's skill with a knife is not lost on Solomon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOLD - LATER - DAY 45 The hold is packed tighter now. Muzzle covering his face, Robert is shackled with his hands tied behind his back. Solomon and Clemens Ray look on. A sailor descends the staircase and takes off Robert's muzzle, shooting him a forbidding look. He leaves. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Solomon, Clemens Ray and Robert, now in mid-conversation. ROBERT I say we fight. Robert delivers this in a hushed voice. SOLOMON The crew is fairly small. If it were well planned, I believe they could be strong armed. CLEMENS RAY Three can't stand against a whole crew. The rest here are niggers, born and bred slaves. Niggers ain't got the stomach for a fight, not a damn one. ROBERT All I know, we get where we travelling we'll wish we'd died trying. CLEMENS RAY Survival is not about certain death, it is about keeping your head down. Solomon looks at Clemens Ray, agitated -- his voice now raised above the previous whispers. Grits his teeth. SOLOMON Days ago I was with my family, in my home. Now you tell me all is lost. "Tell no one who I really am" if I want to survive. I don't want to survive, I want to live. 46 OMIT 46 47 OMIT 47 47A EXT. SEA - DAY 47A The steamboat paddles pound the water, filling the whole frame. The vessel ploughs on south. 32.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . HOLD - NIGHT 48A The slaves are asleep. A Sailor descends the ladder approaching Eliza. He bends down and attempts to wake the daughter by caressing her face. Solomon rouses, and looks across to witness the scene. From his vantage point, we see Eliza stand to interrupt the Sailor. The Sailor looks at Eliza, Eliza looks back at him. Knowingly she leads him off into a corner of the hold. As she does so, Eliza passes Robert who jumps up to stand between Eliza and the Sailor. Stretching out a firm hand to the sailor's shoulder, Robert's look says "No you don't." Clemens Ray is awake now, watching. There is an odd moment of stillness between the Sailor and Robert, an impasse. We focus on the Sailor's face. Slowly, a greasy smile erupts upon it. Back now to Robert's face, a look of incomprehension. Robert looks down. We follow his gaze to the knife that has already been jabbed unseen between Robert's ribs. The sailor withdraws the bloody blade. A wide shot of the two men. Robert collapses to the floor like a sack of potatoes. Clemens Ray and Solomon react. Complete horror. 49 OMIT 49 50 OMIT 50 33.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ORLEANS/DECK - DAY 51 We are back up on the deck of the ship. SOLOMON AND CLEMENS RAY dump ROBERT's body over the side of the ship. Solomon watches as the body churns for a moment in the wake of the vessel... then sinks beneath the water. Clemens Ray, with no sentimentality:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better off. Better than us. 51A EXT. NEW ORLEANS HARBOUR - DAY 51A Solomon's POV from the back of the steamship of Robert's corpse slipping gracefully into the water. 52 EXT. NEW ORLEANS/PORT - DAY 52 -MID MAY, 1841- A white male, fairly smart, with broad shoulders, stands
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clemens...! Clemens Ray! We are in the port of New Orleans, one of the busiest in the young nation. On the dock itself there is a bustle of activity as goods are loaded and unloaded from a various ships. It's a bit of controlled chaos as a VARIETY OF LANGUAGES are spoken and shouted while slaves are shuttled from the Orleans to a holding pen. Solomon, and all the slaves are overwhelmed by all that is happening around them. Two men - among many - are awaiting the arrival of the Orleans. They are JONUS RAY - Clemens Ray's master - and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who is the solicitor of Mr. Ray. They both look like they mean business. The moment the gangplank is laid, Ray yells for Clemens. Clemens, seeing his master, is nearly crazy with delight. He is, uncharacteristically beside himself. Ironically, his master now represents "freedom." (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...My master... Master Ray, sir! Master Ray! Clemens pulls on his chain. As he does so, Several other slaves collapse in his effort to reach his master, like dominos.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is in charge of this vessel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am the Captain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Mr. Jonus Ray. My solicitor has documentation verifying that the Negro named Clemens Ray is my property. As he reads PAPERS handed to him by Davis:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know nothing of--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are ordered by court to return that property immediately, or face charges of thievery.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My duty is to transport goods. I am not responsible for their origin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Remove these contraptions! To his mate:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Free him! Biddee does as ordered. Once free, Clemens hugs and sobs over his master as would a lost and then found child.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all well, now, Clemens. You will return home with me. (to the Captain) Consider this notice and warning. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray, Davis and Clemens head away. Solomon seems both desperate and hopeful of some aid from Clemens and Ray. But there is none forthcoming. Ray and Clemens continue on - Clemens not so much as even looking back in Solomon's direction. Solomon stands and watches as they fade into the environs and are gone from sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEW ORLEANS/PORT - LATER Hours later. The slaves sit off on one side of the dock, baking in the sun, awaiting their fate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - a tall, thin-faced man with light complexion and a little bent - moves along the deck calling out names from a list. The slaves STAND as they are called.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oren. John. Lethe. Eliza. Randall. Emily. Platt... Platt! Solomon does not respond. Freeman looks around. He spots Solomon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, who shipped that nigger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burch. Freeman steps to Solomon. He gives him a looking over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand up. Solomon does as told.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fit the description given. Why didn't you answer when called?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My name is not Platt. My name is-- Freeman strikes Solomon hard across the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your name is Platt, and I will teach you your name so that you don't forget. (to the Captain) Shackle my niggers. Get them to my cart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CART - LATER 54 Solomon is carted off along with the rest of "Burch's stock:" Eliza and her children, John and Solomon. As they move off from the port in a make-shift cart, it opens up to the frenzic, busy port. For the first time Solomon sees true and severe slavery. These are not visiting servants, such as Jasper was back in Saratoga. These are humans held in strict bondage - herded like cattle, chained together as if in a "chain gang." Slaves are evident not merely by the color of their skin. The residue and accessories of slavery are everywhere. Blacks almost universally display scars -
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THESE IMAGES SHOULD BE A CONSTANT AND CONTINUAL CANVAS TO THE PIECE
EVER PRESENT, BUT NOT REALLY COMMENTED ON AS THEY ARE THE NORM

direction.raw_text: - brands, and are often missing limbs. Blacks are held in all types of shackles, from simple chains to elaborate bindings, to neck collars that are spiked. Some are muzzled or forced to wear bits. One slave is attacked by a dog and the slave owner. The dog pulls and tears at the slave's clothes. THESE IMAGES SHOULD BE A CONSTANT AND CONTINUAL CANVAS TO THE PIECE. EVER PRESENT, BUT NOT REALLY COMMENTED ON AS THEY ARE THE NORM. They should be a reminder that not only are people being oppressed, but that there is an entire system of oppression in place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEMAN'S SLAVE PEN - LATER "Burch's stock:" arrive at Freeman's slave pen. They are led in by Freeman and his house slave CAPE - a mulatto. The yard is enclosed by plank, standing upright, with ends sharpened instead of brick walls as with Burch's. Including Burch's group there are about 30 SLAVES in the pen. Solomon and the others look around and see nothing but downtrodden and despondent faces. Three men sit next to each other with muzzles and quietly stare back at this new batch of arrivals. One attempts to speak, but all that comes out is a muffled, unintelligible sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEMAN'S SLAVE PEN - LATER The slaves are in various states of undress, men and women alike. They clean themselves, scrubbing with soap and water. Women wash their hair. Men shave, skin is oiled. Freeman walks among them, inspecting them as they primp themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEMAN'S SLAVE PEN - LATER The slaves are given new clothes by Cape. The men are given hat, coat, shirt, pants and shoes. The women (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THICK AND HEAVY DEAD TISSUE FROM LACERATIONS LEFT UNTREATED

direction.raw_text: frocks of calico and handkerchiefs to bind about their heads.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CAPE PLAYS A PAINFUL TUNE ON A FIDDLE
A SMALL GROUP OF THE SLAVES,

direction.raw_text: . FREEMAN'S/GREAT ROOM - LATER 58 It's an odd, ironic scene. The slaves are in a large and fairly ornate room within Freeman's house. CAPE PLAYS A PAINFUL TUNE ON A FIDDLE - background music - as Freeman tries to line up A SMALL GROUP OF THE SLAVES, he becomes less patient, jittery and nervous, knowing that his livelihood is at stake, he wants his slaves to make a good impression. Sometimes his patience gets the better of him, and his hands move freely in direction of the slaves. The business has the air of an etiquette class, though what Freeman is trying to do is coach the slaves into being more "sellable." He works with them in groups of five or so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tallest to smallest, understand? Are you taller than her? Then you'd go before her. Do it. Move. (to the group) Keep your heads up. A sense of direction; that's how you look smart. None of those saucer eyes. Rid yourself of that smile. Look like a goddamn grinnin' monkey. Put the least thought in your head. C'mon, now. Think of somethin'. Weary of Cape's playing, Solomon moves to Cape. He asks:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you play a reel?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nah. I don't know no reel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I may...? Cape looks to Freeman:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sick of your caterwaulin'. Let him play, boy. Let's see what he can do. Cape reluctantly hands the fiddle over to Solomon. Solomon tunes it a bit, then begins to play. His fingers stiff at first, he takes a moment to warm up. But as he warms up he is, despite the circumstances, masterful. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE SLAVES ALL CLAP ALONG. SOME DANCE ALONG. All admire his work. Freeman chief among them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep on. Keep on. Solomon continues to play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A damn sight better than you, Cape. A damn sight better. Cape looks bitter as Solomon plays on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEMAN'S/GREAT ROOM - DAY We come in on an odd sort of sight; A JUMBLE OF ACTIVITY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: have come to see Freeman's lot - the room all gussied up with flowers. Freeman moves among them, displaying them as a rancher would prize chattel. Freeman makes the slaves hold their heads up - "look smart" as he previously admonished them. They are made to walk briskly back and forth while customers feel their hands and arms and bodies, turn them about and ask what skills they possess. The Customers routinely make the slaves open their mouths and show their teeth. At times a MALE or FEMALE SLAVE are taken off to the side, stripped and inspected more minutely. One of them, John, is stripped and inspected. Cape, as he's done previously, plays his fiddle. A buyer - WILLIAM FORD; a man of middle age, and an attractive nature in his tone of voice - consults a list he's drawn up and asks of Freeman:

direction.raw_text: . FORD PLANTATION - LATER 60 Driven in a horse drawn wagon by Ford are Solomon and Eliza. Eliza is sullen to say the least. With the loss of her two children she has dropped into a depression she will not be able to pull out of. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They arrive to the FORD PLANTATION. The main house of the plantation - the GREAT HOUSE as they are commonly called - is sizable. Two stories high with a piazza in front. In the rear are also a log kitchen, poultry house, corncribs and several slave cabins. The plantation is described as "a green spot in the wilderness." With the arrival of Master Ford there is a flurry of activity - the "excitement" of a new delivery. MR.

direction.raw_text: . FORD'S WORK AREA - DAY John Tibeats, stands before the slaves. Chapin hovers to one side. TIBEATS My name is John Tibeats, William Ford's chief carpenter. You will refer to me as Master. Tibeats nods in Chapin's direction: TIBEATS (CONT'D) Mister Chapin is the overseer on this plantation. He is responsible for all of Ford's property. You too will refer to him as Master. This plantation covers many hundreds of acres, and you will traverse the Texas road between the forest site and the sawmill in double time. Any clever nigger on that path that gets a little lightfooted, I will remind him that on one side men and bloodhounds patrol the border and on the other the bayou provides a hard living, with alligators and little to eat or drink that won't kill you. No slave has escaped here with his life. You're here to work niggers, so let's commence. Tibeats begins to sing the song "Run Nigger, Run" mockingly. We cut to Solomon chopping logs and into the montage of the slaves doing manual labor and arriving back to the sawmill. Lyrics for "Run Nigger, Run" (CONTINUED)

WOODS - DAY 61 -END OF MAY THROUGH EARLY JUNE, 1841- We are in a wooded area. There is A GANG OF SLAVES chopping trees into timber. It is hard, laborious work made no more easy by the sweltering heat. Solomon is among them as well as Sam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WOODS - LATER The slaves now load the timber onto a horse drawn wagon. Again, hard work done under the ever present sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD - LATER 63 As Sam drives the wagon, the other slaves trudge along side by foot. We should get the sense the travel is long and tedious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FORD'S WORK AREA - LATER 64 It is a sizable work area on the edge of Indian Creek. There is much work being done, the slaves primarily employed in piling the timber and chopping it into lumber. As before, there is little doubt about the rigors of the job at hand. Working as a carpenter at the work area is JOHN TIBEATS. There are also various CUSTOMERS who move about placing orders.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FORD PLANTATION - DAY -EARLY TO MID JUNE, 1841- It's Sunday morning. All of Ford's slaves are dressed with their "finest" clothes - brightly colored and as free as possible of defect. The slaves are gathered on (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the lawn just beyond the piazza. Mistress Ford is present as well. As the slaves listen, Ford reads to them Scripture. His tone is of a man trying to preach by way of compassion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "But as touching the resurrection of the dead, have ye not read that which was spoken unto you by God, saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob. God is not the God of the dead, but of the living. And when the multitude heard this, they were astonished at his doctrine. Then one of them, which was a lawyer, asked him a question, tempting him, and saying, Master, which is the great commandment in the law? Jesus said unto him, Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind. This is the first and great commandment. And the second is like unto it, thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself. On these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets." Despite the lightness with which Ford speaks and the hope in his words, ELIZA SITS OFF TO THE SIDE - SELF-SECLUDED A BIT - WEEPING GENTLY. We should be able to see in Mistress Ford's eyes that Eliza's constant crying is unsettling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FORD'S WORK AREA - DAY 70 -MID JUNE, 1841- The slaves have broken for lunch. They snack on smoked meat and drink water from gourds. As they lunch Solomon reads from Sam's Bible to the other slaves.

direction.raw_text: But he that is greatest among you, let him be as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve. For whether is greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that serveth? direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ROAD - DAY 72 Sam is at the reigns of the wagon carrying the timber to Ford's WORK AREA. Slaves trudge alongside, same as it ever was. Only...it's not quite the same. Sam brings the wagon to a halt. He, and the slaves look up the road ahead of them. Standing in the middle of the road is a group of
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They are in their "usual" dress of buckskin breeches and calico hunting shirts of fantastic colors, buttoned from belt to chin. They have with them
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and HORSES. They carry with them the carcass of a deer. The two groups stare at each other for a long moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FIELD - DUSK/END OF DAY The groups of slaves and Chickasaws are now intermingled. They "break bread" - actually they work on the carcass of the deer which is now roasting over a large fire. As well the group share a smoke on a pipe. One of the Chickasaws is playing a tune on an "INDIAN FIDDLE." The Chickasaws perform a customary dance; trotting after each other, and giving utterance to a guttural, sing-song noise. The slaves enjoy the respite from work, Solomon particularly taken by the music...if not entirely enthralled by it. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After a bit, Solomon rights himself and heads from the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . RIVER BANK - CONTINUOUS 74 Solomon arrives to some tall grass at the edge of the river. Lowering his trousers, SOLOMON SQUATS TO DEFECATE. As he does, he stares out toward the flowing waters of Indian Creek. After a few moments, as though a thought far greater than relieving himself has come to him, Solomon stands and replaces his pants. Oddly, Solomon stares out at the water as though he were a man possessed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FORD'S WORK AREA - DAY Just beyond the WORK AREA Solomon speaks with Ford as Tibeats listens. Solomon is drawing in the dirt, making rough diagrams for Ford as he explains himself.

direction.raw_text: I labored repairing the Champlain canal, on the section over which William Van Nortwick was superintendent. With my earnings I hired several efficient hands to assist me, and I entered into contracts for the transportation of large rafts of timber from Lake Champlain to Troy.
